FuncDef:
The display rip route command displays information about all the activated and deactivated RIP routes that are learned from other devices and the values of the timers associated with each RIP route.
The display ripng route command displays all the RIPng routes that are learned from other devices and the values of different timers related to each route. The display rip route command displays information about all the activated and deactivated RIP routes that are learned from other devices and the values of the timers associated with each RIP route. The display ripng route command displays all the RIPng routes that are learned from other devices and the values of different timers related to each route.
CLIs: display rip <process-id> route [ destination-address <destination-ipv4-address> [ <mask-length> ] ] [ [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } ] [ neighbor-address <neighbor-ipv4-address> ] ]

display ripng <process-id> route [ destination-address <destination-ipv6-address> [ <ipv6-mask-length> ] ] [ [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } ] [ neighbor-address <neighbor-ipv6-address> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Displays routes to a specific destination IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of a specific destination IPv4 address.
The value is an integer in the range from 0 to 32.

Specifies the interface type and interface number.
-

Displays routes to a specific IPv4 neighbor.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays routes to a specific destination IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the mask length of a specific destination IPv6 address.
It is an integer ranging from 0 to 128.

Displays routes to a specific IPv6 neighbor.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.
